unnormalised: The Ministry of Education announced the NEET UG 2024 results on 04/06/2024. Approximately 23 lakh students appeared for the exam. Cut-offs for admission to MBBS courses at AIIMS Delhi and other top medical colleges are expected to be high, potentially exceeding 700 out of 720 marks.
normalised: The Ministry of Education announced the N-E-E-T U-G two thousand and twenty four results on fourth June two thousand and twenty four. Approximately twenty three lakh students appeared for the exam. Cut-offs for admission to M-B-B-S courses at A-I-I-M-S Delhi and other top medical colleges are expected to be high, potentially exceeding seven hundred out of seven hundred and twenty marks.

unnormalised: According to sources at the National Testing Agency (NTA), counselling for admission to various undergraduate courses, including engineering and medicine, will commence in July 2024. Students are advised to register on the official websites by 30/06/2024. Several IITs, including IIT Bombay and IIT Madras, will release their first admission lists by 15/07/2024.
normalised: According to sources at the National Testing Agency (N-T-A), counselling for admission to various undergraduate courses, including engineering and medicine, will commence in July two thousand and twenty four. Students are advised to register on the official websites by thirtieth June two thousand and twenty four. Several I-I-T-s, including I-I-T Bombay and I-I-T Madras, will release their first admission lists by fifteenth July two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Changes to the admission process have been implemented this year. It is reported that for centrally funded institutions, 27% of seats are reserved for OBC NCL (Other Backward Classes Non-Creamy Layer), 15% for SC (Scheduled Castes), 7.5% for ST (Scheduled Tribes) and 10% for EWS (Economically Weaker Sections).
normalised: Changes to the admission process have been implemented this year. It is reported that for centrally funded institutions, twenty seven percent of seats are reserved for O-B-C N-C-L (Other Backward Classes Non-Creamy Layer), fifteen percent for S-C (Scheduled Castes), seven point five percent for S-T (Scheduled Tribes) and ten percent for E-W-S (Economically Weaker Sections).
